p: The novel detrimental associations of HLA-B08 and HLA-A29 with maintenance of the LTNP status have little precedent in the literature. HLA-B08 within a common Western haplotype is frequently associated with fast progression of HIV disease, rapid CD4 T lymphocyte decline in adults and with increased mother to infant transmission [ 32, 36, 37], but the association has rarely been individually ascribed to HLA-B08. For HLA-A29 only a non-significant trend has been reported [ 38]. This negative association may interestingly be related to the poor recognition by A29-restricted T lymphocyte clones of viral sequence variants [ 39]. The large Spanish LTNP cohort data thus presents solid evidence for the first time on the negative association of these two HLA alleles with the LTNP status.
